channel.title: Having an app run constantly on a website
channel.description: Right, so I've gone out and bought a website mainly because I have nothing better to do with my money. I want to host this chat server I have on it, but I'm not sure if it's going to send data at all unless it's being run via an applet. Can someone help me out with this one?

item.title: Having an app run constantly on a website
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Thank you both. Now I just need to remember my username and password to forward the ports. >:(

Read full topic
item.source: Having an app run constantly on a website

item.title: Having an app run constantly on a website
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

What mopar said will indeed work, but in regards to hosting it on a different server, you can’t do it unless you have root access…I’ve considered before the possibly of running a cron job, assuming its a *nix server, but I never found out whether that would work. Basically, it needs to run as an application (applet won’t work because it’s client side and does not have the permissions to initialize such objects as ServerSockets) and you can’t run it with limited access.

So your best bet is to run it off your own computer.

Read full topic
item.source: Having an app run constantly on a website

item.title: Having an app run constantly on a website
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

White Castle:

Yes, I’d like help on how to host it on my own computer please. Both the client and the server are pretty much done right now, I’m just adding in extra features ect.

to host the server on your computer, you just have to run it, plus open any port on your router that it uses

Read full topic

item.title: Having an app run constantly on a website
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

I’ve seen alot of your posts about this chat server. Im actually doing the same thing at the moment. Run the client as an applet on the site (Just use a frame if you want it to stay there while the user browses), and host the server on your own computer. If you need any help with this, Id be glad to give ya a hand =)

Read full topic

Sorry, I have no idea how to do anything, but I’ll give you emotional support
Tell me when it’s up and running, I’ll camp the chat
